recipes.title: Gluten Free Cut Out Sugar Cookie

winePairing.pairingText: Cookies works really well with Cream Sherry, Madeira, and Prosecco. Sweet bubbly Prosecco doesn't overwhelm simple sugar or shortbread cookies, a sweet cream sherry complements spiced cookies, and madeira's nutty notes match cookies with nuts perfectly. You could try NV Solera Cream Sherry. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: In a medium-sizebowl, whiskthe flour blend, baking powder, and salt and set aside.In the bowl of your mixer, cream the butter and sugar together until the butter is lighter in color.Add the egg, vanilla and almond extract (if using) and beat until combined.Add the flour mixture slowly and beat on low speed just until combined.Preheat your oven to 350F.Roll the dough out onto sheets of parchment paper to about 1/4-inch thick, transfer to cookie sheets and refrigerate for 1 - 2 hours or until firm.(The longer the dough is refrigerated, theless the dough will spread during baking.)Cut out the cookies using a heart, star or circle cookie cutter spacing them at least 2-inches apart, and remove the extra dough around the cut out dough.Using a smaller cutter, cut out a smaller but identical shape from half the cookie dough cutouts.Using the scraps, repeat the above process, once. (Do not roll those scraps up for cookies as the dough will become too tough.)Bake the cookies for 8 - 9 minutes. Allow them to rest in the baking pan for about 3 minutes and then transfer them to wire racks to cool.Once all cookies are baked, you can then bake the little cut outs, for a shorter time.Once cool, dust the lids (cookies with dough cut out) with confectioners' sugar, if desired.Fill the whole cookies with your favorite jam and top with lid.

steps.step: In a medium-sizebowl, whiskthe flour blend, baking powder, and salt and set aside.In the bowl of your mixer, cream the butter and sugar together until the butter is lighter in color.
Add the egg, vanilla and almond extract (if using) and beat until combined.
Add the flour mixture slowly and beat on low speed just until combined.Preheat your oven to 350F.

Roll the dough out onto sheets of parchment paper to about 1/4-inch thick, transfer to cookie sheets and refrigerate for 1 - 2 hours or until firm.(The longer the dough is refrigerated, theless the dough will spread during baking.)

Cut out the cookies using a heart, star or circle cookie cutter spacing them at least 2-inches apart, and remove the extra dough around the cut out dough.Using a smaller cutter, cut out a smaller but identical shape from half the cookie dough cutouts.Using the scraps, repeat the above process, once. (Do not roll those scraps up for cookies as the dough will become too tough.)

Bake the cookies for 8 - 9 minutes. Allow them to rest in the baking pan for about 3 minutes and then transfer them to wire racks to cool.Once all cookies are baked, you can then bake the little cut outs, for a shorter time.Once cool, dust the lids (cookies with dough cut out) with confectioners' sugar, if desired.Fill the whole cookies with your favorite jam and top with lid.
